item.title: 关税引发 "爱国主义 "重启，基金市场受到冲击
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发动关税战后，全球最大的几家资产管理公司的客户正争先恐后地将资金从美国转移到欧洲基金。【原文：Clients at some of the world’s biggest asset managers are racing to move money away from the US and into European funds in the wake of Donald Trump’s tariff war.】

item.title: 苹果新任 Siri 首席执行官招募 Vision Pro 人才，开始东山再起之路
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc. ）新任 Siri 工程主管正在全面改革领导开发饱受困扰的语音助手的管理团队，他向员工保证，这一举措将为公司的成功奠定基础。【原文：Apple Inc.’s new Siri engineering chief is overhauling the management team leading development of the beleaguered voice assistant, taking a step he assured employees would set the company up for success.】

item.title: 闪灵 "酒店借贷 3 亿美元迎合恐怖片粉丝需求
item.description: 这家曾启发斯蒂芬-金写下畅销书《闪灵》的酒店正在求助于市政债券市场来支付大修费用，以巩固其在电影业的地位，尤其是在恐怖片爱好者中的地位。【原文：The hotel that inspired Stephen King to write his bestsellerThe Shining is turning to the municipal-bond market to pay for a sweeping overhaul in a bid to cement its status in the film industry, particularly among horror aficionados.】

item.title: Instagram 联合创始人称没有 Meta 应用程序也能蓬勃发展
item.description: Instagram 联合创始人凯文-西斯特罗姆（Kevin Systrom）作证说，如果没有被 Meta Platforms 公司收购，他刚刚起步的照片分享应用本可以取得成功，但首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）最终将 Instagram 的发展视为 "威胁"，并剥夺了它的资源。【原文：Instagram co-founder Kevin Systrom testified that his fledgling photo-sharing app could have succeeded without being acquired by Meta Platforms Inc., and that eventually Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg treated Instagram’s growth as a “threat” and starved it of resources.】

item.title: 贝森特认为与中国的关系趋于缓和，局势难以为继
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周二在一次闭门投资者峰会上表示，与中国的关税对峙不可持续，他预计局势将缓和。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told a closed-door investor summit Tuesday that the tariff standoff with China is unsustainable and that he expects the situation to de-escalate.】

item.title: 谷歌副总裁称摩托罗拉手机将增加 Perplexity 和微软人工智能功能

item.title: 亿万富翁保尔森称央行将继续购买黄金
item.description: 亿万富翁对冲基金经理约翰-保尔森（John Paulson）表示，在政治和经济动荡的背景下，各国央行将继续购买黄金，以摆脱纸币的影响。【原文：Central banks will keep buying gold in a push to diversify away from paper currencies amid political and economic upheaval, according to billionaire hedge-fund manager John Paulson.】

item.title: 埃利奥特增持英国石油公司 5%股份，激进主义运动仍在继续
item.description: 埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）已将其在英国石油公司（BP Plc）的持股增至略高于 5%，这位激进投资者将继续向这家陷入困境的石油巨头施压。【原文：Elliott Investment Management has built up its stake in BP Plc to just over 5% of shares, as the activist investor continues its pressure campaign at the struggling oil giant.】

item.title: 加拿大保守党承诺减税、缩减赤字
item.description: 加拿大保守党承诺赤字将少于执政的自由党，因为该党寄希望于减税和放松管制来刺激经济繁荣，尤其是该国能源行业的繁荣。【原文：Canada’s Conservative Party is promising to run smaller deficits than the incumbent Liberals as it bets heavily on tax cuts and deregulation spurring an economic boom, especially in the country’s energy sector.】

item.title: 游说团体称法国新红利税虽有解释但仍有风险

item.title: 特朗普贸易战震撼市场，印度领先对手
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普发动的贸易战震撼了市场和政府，很少有国家能比印度在政治和经济上更好地经受住这场动荡。【原文：As US President Donald Trump shocks markets and governments with his trade war, few countries are weathering the turbulence better than India, both politically and economically.】

item.title: 高盛集团的哈齐乌斯说，特朗普对美联储的攻击会对市场产生重大影响
item.description: 高盛首席经济学家 Jan Hatzius 表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统威胁解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔对金融市场产生了重大影响。【原文：President Donald Trump’s threats to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell have had a significant impact on financial markets, Goldman Sachs Chief Economist Jan Hatzius said.】

item.title: 先锋集团首席执行官称美国例外论 "绝对 "尚未达到顶峰

item.title: 顶级预测师马里诺夫称美元下滑势头可能减弱
item.description: 尽管全球贸易战动摇了美元的避风港地位，并导致美元创下至少二十年来最差的年度开局，但一位顶级预测师表示，本季度美元的跌势可能会有所缓解。【原文：A top forecaster says the dollar’s slump will likely ease this quarter, even as the global trade war has rocked the greenback’s haven status and led to its worst annual start in at least two decades.】

item.title: 拉加德告诉 CNBC，欧洲央行的通胀工作 "即将完成
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）对 CNBC 表示，欧洲中央银行几乎实现了将通胀率恢复到 2% 的目标，但随着经济背景变得更加动荡，必须保持灵活性。【原文：The European Central Bank has almost achieved its goal of returning inflation to 2% but must remain flexible as the economic backdrop becomes more volatile, President Christine Lagarde told CNBC.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告：特朗普的贸易战动摇了金融体系的支柱
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）警告说，唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战正威胁着全球金融稳定，而自2008年危机以来，全球金融稳定一直是银行和保险公司的安全保障，该组织敦促政策制定者加强其行业的防御能力。【原文：President Donald Trump’s trade war is threatening the global financial stability that’s kept banks and insurers safe since the 2008 crisis, the International Monetary Fund warned, as it urged policymakers to bolster their industries’ defenses.】

item.title: 仍受洪氏贷款困扰的银行仍在进行收购交易
item.description: 向高风险公司提供贷款的银行仍然愿意安排一揽子融资计划，尽管一些贷款人遇到了关税引发的动荡，导致他们无法向投资者出售债务。【原文：Banks in the business of lending to risky companies are still willing to arrange financing packages, even as some lenders run into tariff-induced turmoil that’s left them unable to offload debt to investors.】

item.title: 特斯拉董事会因马斯克的关注而遭到州财务主管的抨击

item.title: 格林称，英国央行应考虑在未来冲击期间采取更小规模的量化宽松政策

item.title: 高盛薪酬之争取决于首席执行官是银行家还是私募市场巨头
